Articles.Content: MechJeb is working. Basic functions are fine. Auto-warp creates havoc needing a lot on manual syncing from second player. Rendezvous and Manoeuvre are both problematic, to be expected to be fair. But this thing is basically working here with 2 clients. Sorted initial errors by reading the 'readme' doh Will feedback more as and when... Excellent (not to mention brave) mod

Sync is bugged-it's greyed out most of the time

This is by-design--the sync button is only enabled when there's some-time to sync to.

MK3424, VonnBraun Midgster222 DON'T JOIN. You seem to be causing server crashes

Strange: at first no problems then sync issues (would be the crash issues).

Hey guys, my VPS is up and running!

And about dependencies - mono-complete is redundant

mono-runtime and libmono-system-data2.0-cil is enough

both can be installed by typing sudo apt-get install mono-runtime libmono-system-data2.0.cil in the terminal

Worked for my barebone Debian 7.0 server at least
Hey! I can't download server files from SpacePort I've got error "Failure - network error" every time i click download button...

Been playing for a bit and I noticed two things:

1) CPU usage gets extremely high when server is full and never goes back down, even as people disconnect

Server CPU?

2) Ships are staying on the runway, which causes unexpected errors whenever I try to launch something from the runway.

Can you report this on Github for easier tracking?
Someone else saw this and there's a not-great fix for it on SpacePort now. Seems to happen sporadically when people disconnect. Details here.

Hey guys, my VPS is up and running!

And about dependencies - mono-complete is redundant

mono-runtime and libmono-system-data2.0-cil is enough

both can be installed by typing sudo apt-get install mono-runtime libmono-system-data2.0.cil in the terminal

Worked for my barebone Debian 7.0 server at least

Thanks Queril! README updated to match for next release.
Also, when I launch, it drops random parts on me and the syncs, saying it had and unexpected error

Also, there seems to be an issue.

I can connect to my server, but client crashes immediately on syncing
I will leave my comment after I get a new brain. My old one is all over the wall now.

i see lots of people are disconecting, trying to clean my internet connection as much as possible to see if it fixes

maybe i change the port

Im hosting

ip: 189.123.199.12

port: 2076

like with the other server im getting to handshake recieved and then nothing happens is there something im missing like the fact that i have to turn off my firewall or something?

Also, there seems to be an issue.

I can connect to my server, but client crashes immediately on syncing

Drop your [KSP folder]\KSP.log file on Github (maybe via pastebin) if you can. Thanks!
TehGimp666: Can you please add a button: reconnect because i loose sometimes UDP connection.

like with the other server im getting to handshake recieved and then nothing happens is there something im missing like the fact that i have to turn off my firewall or something?

Shouldn't need to do any firewall tweaking on the client side. Please drop your [KSP folder]\KSP.log file on Github if you're able. Thanks!

Squad - Multiplayer is impossible

Yet a goddamn modder can do it? Proving again how terrible they are......

TehGimp666: Can you please add a button: reconnect because i loose sometimes UDP connection.

The UDP connection is supposed to be re-established automatically when possible, so you may be losing the TCP connection as well if you seem fully disconnected. Might be a server load issue, but only starting to get reports on this particular one.

Hey! I can't download server files from SpacePort I've got error "Failure - network error" every time i click download button...

I'm also having this problem. Bloody spaceport!

edit: it's working now.
